content:
Sure! Here's an example of how you can incorporate the exercises I mentioned into your weekly training routine:

Monday:
- Warm-up: jog for 5-10 minutes
- Strength training: Squats (3 sets of 10 reps), lunges (3 sets of 10 reps each leg), bench press (3 sets of 10 reps)
- Cool-down: stretch for 5-10 minutes

Wednesday:
- Warm-up: jog for 5-10 minutes
- Strength training: Plank (3 sets of 30-60 seconds), bodyweight squats (3 sets of 10 reps), dumbbell lunges (3 sets of 10 reps each leg)
- Cool-down: stretch for 5-10 minutes

Friday:
- Warm-up: jog for 5-10 minutes
- Strength training: Squats (3 sets of 12 reps), bench press (3 sets of 12 reps), deadlifts (3 sets of 10 reps)
- Cool-down: stretch for 5-10 minutes

Remember to listen to your body and take rest days when needed. In addition to strength training, make sure to also incorporate skill-based rugby activities and conditioning into your training routine. It's important to have a well-rounded approach to training to achieve optimal performance on the field.
